description.narrative: Main goal is promoting financing for sustainable development and to enhance dialogue, coordination, national capacities and policy measures aimed at facilitation of effective financing strategy for the achievement of national SDGs in Uzbekistan.

participating-org.narrative: European Civil Protection & Humanitarian Aid Operations

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: European Civil Protection & Humanitarian Aid Operations

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: UNDAF Indicator 7.1: availability of institutional capacities at central government for policy coherence, planning, resource management and operational coordination (roadmaps) for better public service provision

comment.narrative: Current system of public sector management has predominantly sector-based approach for public service provision, with rather weak accountability framework. This impedes structural reforms in providing universal access to quality public service provision

1.1 Capacity building activities including workshops on SDG Budgeting and Budget Tagging methodologies for the Uzbek experts and practitioners conducted. 1.2 The Guidance notes that provide conceptual approaches and recommendations towards designing and operationalization of reforming the SDG based strategic budgeting system, SDG budget coding and tagging system, and green budgeting/climate change budgeting in Uzbekistan developed and submitted to the government. 2.1 Diagnostic Report on Inclusive Insurance and Risk Financing in Uzbekistan developed and discussed with the stakeholders 3.1 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2020” based on the implemented state budget for 2020 has been developed and published at the MOF website. 3.2 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2021” based on the approved state budget for 2021 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media. 3.3 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget – Health Y2021” based on the approved state budget for the Health sector 2020 has been developed and published at the MOF website. 3.4 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2022” based on the draft state budget for 2022 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media. 3.5 The “Open Budget” Information portal has been upgraded and improved 3.6 Guidelines (Information material) on introduction of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan developed 3.7 Roadmap on further development of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan elaborated 3.8 Capacity development activities including the workshops, seminars and trainings for trainers on participatory budgeting conducted

1.1 Workshop on presenting UNDP budget tagging methodologies and experiences on other countries have been conducted virtually on 25 March 2021 for the key MOF staff and experts from other institutions
1.2 The Guidance notes on conceptual approaches towards the introduction of SDG budgeting in Uzbekistan with a focus on green budgeting has been developed and discussed with the MOF and other partners. In addition, the project involved into the close consultations and collaboration with a AFD towards joint work on introduction of SDG Budget Tagging/Green budgeting in Uzbekistan. Several technical workshops on this topic have been conducted jointly with AFD partners for the MOF staff and other partners in July and October 2021.
2.1 A Diagnostic Report on Inclusive Insurance and Risk Financing in Uzbekistan has been developed by a team of local experts and presented/discussed with the stakeholders during the final/validation workshop held on 24 June 2021.
UNDP helps to develop Insurance Sector in Uzbekistan | UNDP in Uzbekistan UNDP Uzbekistan (@UNDP_Uzbekistan) / Твиттер (twitter.com) UNDP Uzbekistan - Публикации | Facebook
3.1 An edition of a Citizens’ Budget devoted to the implemented/executed state budget for Y2020 has been developed by a team of local experts and published at the MOF website.
https://www.mf.uz/ru/news-mf-jx/item/1644-1644.html
3.2 An edition of a Citizens’ Budget devoted to the approved state budget for Y2021 has been developed by a team of local experts and published at the MOF website.
https://www.mf.uz/uz/news-mf-jx/item/1476-2021-yil-uchun-tasdiqlangan-budjetga-bag-ishlangan-navbatdagi-fuqarolar-uchun-budjet-axborot-nashri.html
https://www.mf.uz/ru/news-mf-jx/item/1475-informatsionnoe-izdanie-byudzhet-dlya-grazhdan-posvyashchennoe-utverzhdennomu-byudzhetu-na-2021-god.html
3.3 A special edition of a Citizens’ Budget devoted to the budget expenditures for the health sector in Y2021 has been developed by a team of local experts and published at the MOF and UNDP websites.
Министерство финансов представляет информационное издание “Бюджет для граждан”, посвященное анализу средств, выделяемых из государственного бюджета на здравоохранение в 2021 году - Министерство финансов Республики Узбекистан (mf.uz)

3.4 An edition of a Citizens’ Budget devoted to the draft state budget for Y2022 has been developed by a team of local experts and published at the MOF website.
Представляется вниманию общественности очередное информационное издание «Бюджет для граждан» - Министерство финансов Республики Узбекистан (mf.uz) https://www.mf.uz/media/file/state-budget/2022/budget_dlya_grajdan/proekt-2022.pdf
3.5 The “Open Budget” Information portal has been significantly upgraded with new functionalities added to make it more user-friendly and creating a sound platform for promoting citizen’s involvement in the process of participatory/initiative budgeting that has been piloted by the government in 2021. The official launch of the mechanism of participatory budgeting and the presentation of the upgraded “Open Budget” portal has been conducted on 9 July 2021
Состоялась презентация информационного портала Открытый бюджет - Министерство финансов Республики Узбекистан (mf.uz) https://www.uz.undp.org/content/uzbekistan/en/home/presscenter/pressreleases/2021/07/the-open-budget-portal-expands-the-opportunities-for-citizens-p.html
3.6 Methodological and information materials, including the Guidelines/Manual on participatory/initiative budgeting has been developed by a team of local experts and submitted to the MOF. In addition, various Information leaflets and materials on the new mechanism of citizens’ participation in the budgetary process has been developed and disseminated among the population of the pilot regions.
3.7 The Project team provided support in elaboration of a Roadmap on further development of the participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan that has been adopted by the President’s Resolution № PP-5250 dated 22.09.2021 «On measures to expand the mechanism of financing the projects proposed by the citizens through the «OpenBudget.uz» Information portal”.
Joylardagi muammolarni hal etilishida fuqarolarga qo‘shimcha imkoniyatlar berilmoqda - Ozbekiston Respublikasi Moliya Vazirligi (mf.uz)
3.8 A Training of Trainers for the pilot regions including the staff of the MOF, Institute of Fiscal Studies, and the Training Center under the MOF of Uzbekistan has been organized on 23 April 2021 with participation of the Russian expert Mr. Valadimir Vagin who has been involved under the support of the “Russian Experts’ on Demand Programme” within the framework of UNDP Regional Project on “Knowledge Management and Capacity Development in Russia-UNDP Partnership”.
https://www.mf.uz/ru/news-mf-jx/item/1573-1573.html
In addition, a 3-day workshop on various aspects of participatory/initiative budgeting has been organized during 19-21 October 2021 for more than 70 specialists of the MOF Regional financial departments and local authorities jointly with the Institute of Fiscal Studies, the MOF Training Center and the Scientific-Research Financial Institute under the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation.
Повышение потенциала территориальных финансовых органов по администрированию процесса инициативного бюджетирования - Министерство финансов Республики Узбекистан (mf.uz) Increasing the capacity of territorial financial authorities to administer the process of initiative budgeting - Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan (mf.uz) ПРООН способствует развитию инициативного бюджетирования в Узбекистане (undp.org) UNDP promotes development of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan | UNDP in Uzbekistan UNDP promotes the development of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan (uzdaily.com) ПРООН способствует развитию инициативного бюджетирования в Узбекистане (uzdaily.uz)

1.1 Report of International expert on Development Finance Assessment for Uzbekistan elaborated and discussed with national partners and stakeholders. 1.2 Rapid Integrated Assessment on the alignment of the Sustainable Development Goals with national strategies/plans/budgets conducted by local experts. 1.3 Concept paper on elaboration of a holistic Financing Strategy for the National Development Plan elaborated and discussed with national partners and stakeholders. 2.1 Analytical paper on landscaping the Innovative financing instruments in Uzbekistan developed. 2.2 Analytical paper on landscaping the Islamic financing instruments in Uzbekistan developed. 2.3 Analytical paper on landscaping the Green Sukuk bonds in Uzbekistan developed. 2.4 Capacity building activities to learn good international practices in the area of alternative and innovative financing instruments conducted for national partners. 3.1 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2019” based on the implemented state budget for 2019 developed and presented to national/international partners and general public. 3.2 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2020” based on the implemented state budget for 2020 developed and presented to national/international partners and general public. 3.3 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2021” based on the draft state budget for 2021 and a developed and presented to national/international partners and general public. 3.4 Analytical note on exploring the opportunities for piloting and introduction of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan developed and presented to stakeholders. 3.5 An Open Budget web portal improved and upgraded. 4.1 Inputs and contributions to the Poverty Reduction Strategy provided.

1.1 Development Finance Assessment (DFA) Report has been developed by the international expert. The DFA is aimed to provide a comprehensive analysis of the existing financial resources and identifies opportunities to mobilize additional sources of finance to achieve the development goals in the country. The report also provides the analysis of financing sustainable and resilient recovery from the COVID-19 crisis in line with the country’s longer-term sustainable development priorities and identified financing opportunities for the Government to consider for financing its COVID-19 recovery efforts. Key findings and recommendations of the DFA has been presented and discussed with the national partners and stakeholders during the validation workshop held on 9 December 2020. The event was jointly conducted with the UN Joint Programme on “Establishment of an INFF for Sustainable Development in Uzbekistan” (UN JP on Establishing an INFF).
https://uzbekistan.un.org/en/104341-un-agencies-launch-new-joint-programme-support-uzbekistans-financing-sustainable-development
1.2 Rapid Integrated Assessment on the alignment of the Sustainable Development Goals with the national strategies/plans/budgets has been conducted by the local experts and its key findings has been incorporated into the Development Finance Assessment Report.
1.3 Due to the launch of the new UN Joint Programme on “Establishment of an INFF for Sustainable Development in Uzbekistan” the activity on development of a Concept paper on holistic Financing Strategy for the National Development Plan will be implemented within the framework of the JP.
2.1 Analytical papers on landscaping analysis of the Islamic financing instruments and Innovative financing instruments in Uzbekistan respectively have been developed by the local experts and presented to the national partners and stakeholders during the workshop held on 28 August 2020.
https://vodiymedia.uz/content//islomijmoliiazbiekistonniambaaltchilikdanolibtchiadi.html
2.2 A Strategic Assessment Study of the Green Sukuk Ecosystem in Uzbekistan has been conducted under the support of the UNDP Istanbul Centre for Private Sector in Development and key findings presented to the stakeholders during the Validation workshop held on 25 November 2020. This activity has been co-financed by the UN JP on Establishing an INFF.
2.3 Good international practices in the area of Islamic financing instruments including the green sukuk and Innovative financing instruments have been presented to the national partners and stakeholders during the workshop held on 28 August 2020
3.1 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2019” based on the implemented state budget for 2019 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media.
3.2 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2020” based on the implemented state budget for 2020 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media. https://telegra.ph/Measures-to-increase-the-openness-and-transparency-of-budget-data-09-02
3.3 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2021” based on the draft state budget for 2021 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media.
https://www.mf.uz/ru/news-mf-jx/item/1188-1188.html https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/11/30/budget2021/ https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/11/30/debt/ https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/11/30/taxpayers-20/
3.4 Review of International good practices in the area of participatory budgeting has been developed under support of the UNDP-Russia “Experts On-demand Programme and presented to the stakeholders during the workshop held on 8 July 2020.
https://www.mf.uz/ru/news-mf-jx/item/695-695.html
3.4 In addition, an Analytical note on exploring the opportunities for piloting and introduction of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan developed and presented to stakeholders. Currently the Program on introduction of participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan is in the process of development.
3.5 An Open Budget web portal is in the process of improvement and upgrading.
4.1 A Team of International and local experts has been recruited to provide technical and policy advice to senior government officials focusing on the medium and long–term poverty reduction priorities with attention to SDGs, national development strategies, as well as conduct analysis and elaborate thematic reports on social protection, labor market policies, entrepreneurship and regional development and data issues under the Poverty Reduction Strategy.
4.2 In addition, a Socio-economic impact assessment (SEIA) of the Covid-19 pandemic on entrepreneurship in Uzbekistan based on the 1st Round of the Business survey developed and key findings presented to the national partners and stakeholders during the Round table held on 11 November 2020. In addition, a 2nd Round of the Business survey has been conducted and respective Report on SEIA of the Covid-19 pandemic on entrepreneurship in Uzbekistan developed.

3.1 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2021” based on the implemented state budget for 2021 has been developed and published at the MOF website. 3.2 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2022” based on the approved state budget for 2022 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media. 3.3 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget – Local Budget for Y2022” based on the approved Local budget of the Namangan Region for Y2022 has been developed and published at the MOF website. 3.4 Publication of a “Citizens’ Budget Y2023” based on the draft state budget for 2023 has been developed and published at the MOF website and local media. 3.5 The “Open Budget” Information portal has been upgraded and improved 3.6 Information and promoting materials on participatory budgeting in Uzbekistan developed 3.7 Capacity development activities including the workshops, seminars and trainings for trainers on participatory budgeting conducted
